section.title: Document Overview
section.para: This document describes the Fusion Corporate Channels front-end for users managing the parameters of the system at a customer site. Such users are referred to as called Client Administrators in this document, and should not be confused with the administrators of the system at a bank site.

The main tasks performed by a Client Administrator are: maintenance of their fellow users; adjusting system jurisdiction to suit the characteristics of their company; and maintenance of some static data shared by all users in the company. All these features are available within a single menu in the same page. These functions can be accessed by clicking Administration on the action bar on your home page, and selecting the required function.

listitem.para: Change Profile
Entity Maintenance
Jurisdiction Maintenance
User Maintenance
Data Maintenance
Payee Maintenance
Alerts Maintenance
Report Designer
Audit Queries

section.para: In each section, an introduction provides an overview of the function followed by a detailed description of each option available in the module. An option generally corresponds to a sub-menu item.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: A Fusion Corporate Channels system is used by two types of organisation: banks, and companies that are customers of banks. We refer to the latter as "customers" or "clients" - we use these two terms interchangeably.
In addition, we use the term "bank group" to mean a site with overriding authority over the system, such as a bank's head office.
A member of the staff of a client or bank is called a "user". A user with special administrator privileges is called an "administrator".
A Fusion Corporate Channels system has two different user interfaces: for a user at a client, and for a user at a bank or bank group.

Both interfaces have a section called System Features, containing functions for administering and configuring the Fusion Corporate Channels system. The rest of the interface contains end-user functions. Which functions are available to a given user depends on that user's privileges.
The document that a bank can provide, such as Letters of Credit, Standby Letters of Credit, Shipping Guarantees, and so on, are referred to as "products".

The communications between bank and client about an individual instance of a product typically consist of a sequences of messages. For example, the communications regarding a Letter of Credit would consist of the client's initial request, the bank's formal response, possibly some free-format messages containing further discussion, and possibly some further responses from the bank.

These individual messages are called "transactions" or "transaction events". Those sent by the bank in reply to a client message are called "reporting messages" (because the bank is "reporting back" - they should not be confused with reports produced using the Report Designer module). The whole set of messages concerning one instance of a individual product is called a "file" (this represents a "file of documents" and should not be confused with the files that can be uploaded containing details of a transaction).

section.title: Audience
section.para: This manual is addressed to an administrator at a client, and describes the administrator functions in the client user interface.

section.title: Access Permissions and Administration
section.para: The Administration module is accessible for all logged-in company users from the company home page. However, different users see different features available, depending on their permissions. User permissions can be fully customised, but the following main categories of user can be highlighted:

listitem.para: All trade users are given access to the Change Profile module.
Senior trade users are responsible for the Data Maintenance module.

The administrator user is given access to the Change Profile, Jurisdiction Maintenance and User Maintenance modules. An administrator user may also be given access to the Audit module, in order to monitor the actions carried out by via the application by the users in the company.

section.para: When the customer company is initially created, an administrator user is automatically created with the login ID admin and the password password, and granted the default permissions required to create and administer additional users.

section.title: Administration Terminology
section.para: A Role defines a set of basic permissions (such as create LC, add user and so on) that the system checks before giving a user access to the corresponding functionalities. Roles therefore define user profiles.

The Roles are prepared by the bank to match the company jurisdiction organisation: basic roles giving access to all trade functionalities can be defined, but fine grained roles can also be tuned and prepared if required by the company, in order to match a more complex company organisation.

Roles are then granted to users through Administration, who are consequently granted the corresponding permissions. Roles are therefore the perfect way to set up a particular user profile, and are particularly useful to ease and simplify administration tasks.

section.title: Date and Amount Formats
section.para: When entering a date in a date field, two formats are available. You can enter it in the form DD/MM/YYYY or DDMMYY if your locale is for instance France, or in the form MM/DD/YYYY or MMDDYY if your locale is for instance the USA.
For example, entering 180401 produces a display of 18/04/2001, which in a French locale corresponds to 18th April 2001.

When you enter an amount, the system automatically formats the value entered according to the currency selected. You can either enter the amount using the decimal and group delimiters of your locale (for example, respectively [,] and [space] for France, or [.] and [,] for Singapore), or directly as a series of digits.
For example, 123456.00 in a Singaporean locale produces a display of 123,456.00 if the currency involved is associated with 2 decimal places.

section.title: Forward and Back Browser Buttons Behaviour
section.para: When you use a Browser's Forward and Back buttons, the browser's default behaviour is displayed and Fusion Corporate Channels doesn't provide any customised messages.

section.title: Antivirus Scanning Service
section.para: This service provides an interface from Fusion Corporate Channels to an antivirus scanner of your company's choice. You can scan any attachment for viruses before uploading it from any transaction screen in Fusion Corporate Channels.

note.para: This service is enabled by the Fusion Corporate Channels Administrator.

section.title: Common Features
section.para: Many options, when selected, display a page that lists relevant records. These list pages have some things in common:

listitem.para: You can enter search criteria in a group of fields at the top of the page and click Search, to make the list show only records that match these criteria. These fields represent the most important fields in the record, as do the columns in the table.
You can use wildcards in these fields. The wildcard character is an asterisk (*). You can use it anywhere in a field.

On pages where the list might be very long - for example, if there are many transactions - the list is not displayed until you have entered the search criteria and clicked Search. In these cases, enter an asterisk in any of the search fields to get the entire list.
If a company has entities defined in its profile, then a column and a search criterion field for Entity appear in addition to the columns and fields mentioned in the individual descriptions below.
You can click the triangular icons in the heading of a column to sort the display on that column in ascending or descending order.
There may be a column where you can click to open the individual record for viewing or editing. These are described in the sections for the individual options.

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality
section.para: Maker-Checker is a functionality where a transaction has to be approved by another user before it can be processed. The transaction created by a user (maker), has to be checked and approved by another user (checker) with required permissions. This functionality is permissions driven and users can be assigned either as a maker or a checker, or both. A user can also be assigned as a maker for one transaction and as a checker for another transaction. The maker can view details for all rejected transactions by using Audit Trail.

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality - Client Admin
section.para: The following is the list of system features functions where Maker-Checker is available for Client Admins:

listitem.para: User: creation, modification, deletion
Authorisation Matrix: creation, modification, deletion
User Accounts Access: assignment
Beneficiary Master: creation, modification, deletion is only applicable if the PAB flag is ticked
Reset Password

section.title: Maker-Checker Functionality - Workflow
section.para: The following is the maker-checker workflow:

listitem.para: For each function listed, the following additional columns are displayed for users with Checker permissions:
Status - The status is used to indicate the type of pending transaction for checker to validate (Add, Modify and Delete).
Maker User Id - The user Id of the creator of the transaction.

You can modify a transaction by clicking the Edit icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete icon. If the checker feature for your user ID is enabled for a particular transaction, you can cancel a transaction by clicking on the Cancel icon and review by clicking on the Approve or Reject or Return icon. Clicking on the Approve or Reject or Return icon displays the Approve or Reject or Return form.

You can review the transaction details and use the buttons at the bottom of the page to process further. You can choose to approve, reject or return the transaction submitted by maker. Refer to the section on Action Buttons for information on button functions. You can enter your comments for returning a transaction in the Comments (for return) text box.

section.para: The operations that can be performed from this form are listed below. They appear at the bottom of the page. For each of them, a popup window will appear to confirm the choice.

entry.para: Operation
Description
Approve the transaction.
Reject the transaction.
Return the transaction to the maker with comments. The transaction is displayed with the status 'Returned' to the maker, and the maker can correct it and submit it again to the checker for a review.
Leave the current page and return to the System Features menu.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This module has just one function on the System Features menu, called Change Profile.
All users can use the Change Profile module to view and update their language and password. No particular jurisdiction is required to use this feature.
When you click this function, you are presented with a form to update your profile.

section.title: Change Profile Form
section.para: After entering your changes, click Save at the bottom of the form.
When the password is changed, the password expiry date is computed and stored, and the invalid login attempts counter is reset.
Depending on the system parameters, the new password may be checked against previously used passwords, and may be rejected. This prevents you simply re-using the same password.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Entity Maintenance module to maintain entities within the company.
This module has just one function on the System Features menu, called Entity Maintenance.

section.title: Entity Maintenance Form
section.para:
When you click this function, you are presented with a list of existing entities. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity ID, Name, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.
Only the Entity ID and Name fields are available if maker-checker functionality is not enabled.
The list of the company's entities has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
The defined name of the Entity.
Name of the Entity.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify an Entity by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. If maker-checker functionality is enabled, then the Action
icon is displayed to the Checker if the entity creation is awaiting approval. And for entity creations awaiting approval, the Cancel
icon is displayed to the Maker, which provides the Maker the option to cancel the entity creation by clicking this button before approval.

note.para: When you delete an Entity, its account and all its user accounts (including the administrator user) are deleted from the system. However, all transaction data is kept in the system for historical and inquiry purposes. They should be purged separately from the transaction functions.

section.para: Click the Add a new entity button at the bottom of the list to add an account.
Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the Customer Entity. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.

section.title: Customer Entity Form - System Settings
section.para:
This section contains the System settings for this entity:
Field
Type
Description
Authorise Own Transaction
You can select this option to enable users authorise their own transactions.
By default, this option is not selected, and any transaction will require authorisation by a user assigned with the appropriate role-permissions.
Bulk Authorise Limit at Payment
If you select this option, the system will check if the highest transaction amount of the bulk payment is within the set authorisation limit. If the amount exceeds the limit, the transaction will not be processed.
By default, this option is not selected, and the system will check whether the total amount of the bulk payments is within the set authorisation limit. If the total amount exceeds the limit, the transactions will not proceed.
Auto Forward Date
You can select this option to set auto forward of transaction processing dates. Transactions can be auto forwarded if the cut-off time is exceeded or if the transaction processing date is a holiday.
By default, this option is not selected. If it is in the not-selected state, you may have to amend the transaction processing date (if you created the transaction) or move the transaction to draft for amendment (if you are required to authorise the transaction).
File Upload Settings
This subsection provides setting details for processing bulk upload of transactions from files.
The settings described here are applicable only for the client's File Upload screen in Cash Services. These settings are not applicable for file upload features on other screens in the application.
Check File Hash Value
You can select this option if you want the system to check for hash values when files are uploaded. Any difference in the values in the file and the expected hash values will reject the file upload and generate an error log.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Files (MD5)
You can select this option if you want the system to check and compare for MD5 hash values between the file being uploaded and the file previously uploaded during the same calendar day (12AM to 12PM period). If the files share the same MD5 hash value, the system will reject the upload and display a message that the file cannot be uploaded.
By default, this option is not selected.
Check Duplicate Customer Reference
You can select this option if you want the system to check bulk upload of transactions against the database for duplicate customer references. Any duplicate records found in the file will be treated according to whether the file type is amendable or non-amendable.
By default, this option is not selected, and in this state, the system will not check for any duplicate references and upload the transactions.
File Upload Encryption Method
You can specify the encryption method to be used when uploading files.
Non - Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in non-amendable files. The following options are available:
Reject whole file if any error Process successful transactions and reject errors
Merge/de-merge/delete allowed
You can select this option if you want the system to merge, de-merge or delete transactions from bulk upload files. This applies only to non-amendable file types.
By default, this option is not selected.
Transactions from amendable file type can be merged/de-merged/deleted.
Amendable File Types
You can select the action to take for errors encountered in amendable files. You can use 'All bulks to draft if any error' to save as draft and repair the file. You can use 'Bulk successful and transaction with error separately' to process successful entries, and save any entries with errors as draft and repair the file.
All bulks to draft if any error Bulk successful and transaction with error separately

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Jurisdiction Maintenance function to customise the default jurisdiction setup created by the bank.

Jurisdiction defines the maximum amount of money that your users are authorised to submit a transaction for. You can assign combination of roles and permissions to your users, which allows them to perform transactions on permitted products and for a set amount. If a user does not have sufficient privileges for submitting a transaction, another user with the necessary privileges can submit the transaction.

For Banker's Guarantee transactions in trade, you can set the authorisation matrix for your users, permitting them to use products or sub products with the tenor and maximum amount limit configured. For example, you can set up the authorisation matrix for an Issued Banker's Guarantee (BG) for events such as New, Amend, or Message, for a specific amount and tenor (period). The following illustration is an example for a BG authorisation matrix setup:

row.entry: Type
Sub Product Type
Tenor
Limit Amount
New
Bid Bond
0-1 Year
Amend
Performance
Upto 5 Years
New
Tender
0-6 Months

section.para: The authorisation matrix can be set up for issuance, amendment, message, and also if it is of multiple levels authorization, can be sequential or non sequential.

For higher transaction amounts, or more hierarchical company organisations, the maximum amount can also be defined for a combination of two roles. In such a case the transaction must first be checked by a user with a controller profile (role 1), and then signed by a user with a sign profile (role 2). This authorisation jurisdiction system can therefore force a validation by two users as well as the input user (known as a six-eyes validation).

The authorisation amounts are expressed in the company's base currency. Whenever a transaction is submitted, a middle rate conversion is used to compare the transaction amount with these maximum authorisation amounts. The rates are fetched from the Fusion Corporate Channels's rate table.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance Options
section.para: The Jurisdiction Maintenance Options are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Assign local names to the roles created by the bank, in order to match your company's own naming conventions and facilitate further administration tasks.
Define the properties of each role, overriding the properties defined for it by the bank. You can set limits to the amount that users with particular roles are allowed to process.

section.title: Jurisdiction Maintenance - Roles
section.para: You can assign local names to the roles created by the bank.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the roles the company can use and their descriptions. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the role Reference field at the top of the page.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The list of roles has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
Role name defined by the bank.

Role description, also used as a name for the role within your company. This role description will be shown in the User Role Definition screens, and can be used to better describe/specify the meaning of the role.
This feature is especially useful if you want to map the roles defined by the bank onto internal naming conventions used in your organisation.
If no description has been entered, the role name (shown in the Reference column) is used instead.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all roles for which your company has created a local definition (overriding the bank's definition of the role). Add an authorisation.
The Transaction Type and Product can be wildcard's. In some configurations, the system may therefore get several lines matching the context of the current transaction. In order to decide which line should apply, a concept of best match is introduced whereby the definition of the Transaction Type has always the priority on the Product.

section.para:
You can modify an authorisation by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

section.title: Authorisation Form - Authorisation
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank (except that the Currency is set to your company's base currency and the Type and Product fields are set to wildcard) and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the authorisation. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

Product that this authorisation is to apply to. Select from the dropdown list. Wildcard if it applies to all types. Valid options are:* (All types) Banker's Guarantee Banker's Guarantee Received Bulk Order Credit Note Credit Note CR Export Collection Export Letter of Credit Factoring Financing Request Foreign Exchange Fund Transfer Import Collection Import Letter of Credit Import Open Account Invoice Invoice Payable Inward Remittance Issued Letter of Indemnity Issued Standby LC License Loan Purchase Order Purchase Order Apply Received Standby LC Secure Email Shipping Guarantee Term Deposit

listitem.para: Selecting any of the options starts the period of the application from 0 days. For example, selecting 'From 1 Year to 3 Year' means from 0 days to 3 years. Similarly, selecting 'From 3 Year to 5 Year' means from 0 days to 5 years.

Click this box if a user with the 'Verify' permission must verify (submit) the transaction before the authorisation matrix is applied.
Send indicates only a user with the 'Send' permission can submit the transaction, after the authorisation matrix has been applied.

If 'Sequential' is selected, when multiple authorisation levels are required for a transaction, they must be performed in the sequence defined under authorisation levels below. Otherwise, all levels must still authorise the transaction but they can be in any order.

(a user can have only one authorisation level. See User Maintenance> Profiles)
Click this button to select additional levels required to authorise a transaction.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the User Maintenance module to create, modify or delete user accounts at your company, define the permissions granted to those users, and reset user passwords.
The creation of a new user profile normally requires three steps:

listitem.para: Create new user profile (using User Maintenance > Profiles)
Associate bank accounts to the user (using User Maintenance > User Accounts)
Activate the user (using User Maintenance > Profiles)

section.title: Terminology
section.para: The term User Profile is used to mean a user's registration with a system enabling him or her to log in. While the term User Accounts is often used to indicate the same function as a profile, in this section, a User Account will generally be used to refer to a bank account belonging to, or associated with, a user or company

section.title: User Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the User Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select Administration > User Maintenance.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the User Maintenance function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: User Maintenance Options
section.para: After selecting Administration > User Maintenance from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for User Maintenance in the left side navigation menu.The User Maintenance options are part of the Administration menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain user accounts. A user's login details are called his or her profile. You can create new accounts, update existing accounts, and delete existing accounts. You cannot delete your own account. A company's main default administrator account can only be deleted by the bank. When you create a new user account, you are then shown a link to set up the user's permissions.
Assign Accounts to users. In this context, the user is linked to specific bank accounts used by the company.
Reset user passwords.

section.title: User Maintenance - Profiles
section.para: You can maintain user accounts as an Administrator. A user's login details are called his or her profile. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing user accounts at your company. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Last Name, First Name and Login fields at the top of the page.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The list of existing user accounts has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
First Name and Last Name of the user.
Login Id used by the user to log into Fusion Corporate Channels. This login Id uniquely identifies a user account within the company.

This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker. Choose from the dropdown status : Inactive, Active or Lock.
The inactive status will show when maker-checker functionality is enabled.
Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para:
You can modify an account by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, view it in non-editable mode by clicking the View
icon, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.

You cannot delete your own account. A company's main default administrator account admin can only be deleted by the bank. Therefore the entries for these accounts do not have the Delete
icon.
If a user that you delete has initiated some transaction events that are still pending, a new Save or Submit of these transactions needs to be done by an authorised user to re-activate them.

Click the Add a new user button at the bottom of the list to add an account. Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank (except that the Company is set to your company) and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the user's account. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

section.title: Profiles form - Main Details
section.para:
The Clone User checkbox enables a user to clone an existing user profile.
The selected user profile is cloned barring the Login ID and Password.

Field

(Present only for Add.) Default password for the user.
The password policy, which defines the maximum and minimum length of the password, the characters accepted, and the combination of characters, is set up in the system by your administrator.

You can enter up to 5 lines of 35 characters each.

You can enter or view the customer's postal code.
You can enter a maximum of 16 characters in this field.
Status
Select from the dropdown list: Inactive, Active or Lock. This is useful to temporarily inactivate and disable the user's access to Fusion Corporate Channels. (Mandatory)
Authentication mode
Password authentication to be used for user's transactions on Fusion Corporate Channels. Select from the dropdown list: Password or No Re-Authentication. Selecting Password will prompt users to enter transaction password and no re-authentication does not place this restriction. (Mandatory)

section.title: Data Maintenance - Introduction
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Data Maintenance module to maintain various lists of data useful to your company - details of counterparties, frequently used phrases, and so on.

These are the lists that are invoked through popup windows in the transactional modules (see the User Manual - Client), generally by clicking a magnifying glass icon. For example, in the Import Letter of Credit module, the beneficiary is selected from such a list.

section.title: Data Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Data Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select Administration > Data Maintenance.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the Data Maintenance function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Data Maintenance Options
section.para: After selecting Administration > Data Maintenance from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for Data Maintenance in the left side navigation menu.They are as follows:

listitem.para: Maintain the list of available customers' migration data.

Maintain the list of available customer Counterparties, that is, companies that transactions are related to. They can be beneficiaries of Letters of Credit, Banker's Guarantees and Fund Transfers, transportation companies for Shipping Guarantees, drawees for Export Documentary Collections or for Invoices or Invoice Payables.
Upload details of Counterparty in bulk using comma-separated value format.

Maintain the list of available bank Counterparties, that is, external banks that are dealt with (other than those where your company has accounts). They can be, for example, the optional Advising Bank for a Letter of Credit or the Presenting Bank for an Export Collection.

Maintain the list of your company's bank accounts. These are typically specified in a transaction to tell the bank which accounts to debit or credit (for example, for debit of charges and commissions).
Maintain the list of frequently used phrases. These are chunks of predefined texts that a user can include in the narrative fields that appear on many forms.
Maintain a master for the list of beneficiaries. This list can be used by users when creating specific transactions.
Upload details of beneficiaries in bulk using comma-separated value format.

Maintain the list of your company's bank accounts. These are typically specified in a transaction to tell the bank which accounts to debit or credit (for example, for debit of charges and commissions).

Add external accounts for your company. This will help your customers to configure and maintain statements of accounts held at other banks in a single view and download the information from the Account Statement screen.

Maintain the list of your company's external accounts statements uploaded. You can upload an MT940 formatted file here to be displayed to your customers on the Accounts Statement screen. This information can then be downloaded in CSV, PDF or MT940 format by your customers.
Maintain the list of credit facilities that banks have given your company and the allocation limits across various branches.
Maintain the details of the FSCM programmes.
Maintain the details of the FSCM Counterparty programmes.

section.title: Data Maintenance - Migration Data
section.para: This function allows an Administrator to maintain the list of migration data. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the System ID, Product, Ccy and Date fields at the top of the page.

To submit the the entity migration data, first you need to select the entity. To perform this, go to search icon from the Entity field and type Abbreviated Name and Name in the field provided and then click Search.
The list of existing customer migration data has the following columns:

Currency code for the maximum amount. This currency is the base currency of the company. Users can click icon and a popup with the list of currencies appears. If required, users can enter values for currency name by clicking on the search button to refine the list.
Users can define the criteria to view the duration of list of migrated data by selecting the date range from the drop down calender provided.

section.para: Maintain the list of available customer Counterparties. When this option is selected, a list of all the existing customer Counterparties will be shown.
This list can be filtered by entering search criteria in the Entity (if present), Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
There is also a button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.

This list can be filtered by entering search criteria in Date and File Status fields at the top of the page.

Successful
Failed
Successful(P)
Successful(P) status states that Counterparty File Upload is partially successful, one or many files have Failed status.

entry.para: Symbol

section.title: Data Maintenance - Banks
section.para: This function allows an Administrator to maintain the list of available banks. That is, banks that are not associated with the banks providing the portal. When selected, this option will display a list of all the existing bank counterparties.
Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are the Entity (if present), Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.
There is also a button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
The list of existing bank counterparties has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description

row.entry: Entity that this bank Counterparty is available to. (Field is present only if Entities are used.)

entry.para: Abbreviated name of the bank Counterparty, uniquely identifying it. This is used as a reference key of the record and is generally not displayed in transactions.
Name of the bank Counterparty (most often a bank name) as it appears when used in a transaction record.

Description

Click to delete the bank.

Description

section.title: Data Maintenance - Beneficiary File Upload
section.para: This option is used to upload a set of beneficiaries using a .TXT or .CSV file in comma-separated value format. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all beneficiary file uploads for your bank and the statuses of the uploads.You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields at the top of the page.

You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Entity, Date, Product Type, File Status, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page. Wildcard's can be used to filter out more selectively the records returned.

note.para: The Status and Maker User fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: When you select this option, a list of all the beneficiary uploads in the system is returned under the form of a searchable and sortable list of items.

entry.para: Field
Description
Entity within your company that is linked to the beneficiary.

note.para: This column is displayed if your company has the Entity feature enabled.

entry.para: Name of the Bank chosen by the customer. If the Product Type is MT 103 Telegraphic Transfer, this column displays the asterisk (*) symbol.

note.para: This column is displayed if your company has the Multi-bank feature enabled.

entry.para: Select the date range (From and To) for the search.

Type of product. Select a product type from the dropdown list, as shown below. * (All types) Cashier's Order/Demand Draft Third Party Transfer MT 103 Telegraphic Transfer Domestic Transfer India Domestic Transfer
Description for the file upload.
Status of the beneficiary file upload. The information indicates whether the upload was successful, partially successful, pending or a failure.
Indicates the status of the file upload set by the checker, or waiting for action by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: Click the Upload New File button at the bottom of the list to upload beneficiary details.

If maker-checker is enabled for your company, then this button is available only for profiles with maker role. You can view the details for the file uploads by clicking the View
icon. The details form includes sections for General Details, File Details and Uploaded File Results. The section for File Details displays the number of records uploaded and a link to view the uploaded file. The Uploaded File Results section displays details for the number of new beneficiaries, number of modified beneficiaries and number of failed beneficiaries.

tip.para:
If the checker has returned the file upload, you can modify by clicking the Edit
icon. You can also chose to cancel a file upload by clicking on the Cancel
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon. If maker-checker is enabled for your company and if the checker role is assigned to you, then you can view the details for the file uploads by clicking the View
icon, and perform approve, reject or return by clicking the Action
icon for records that are awaiting your (checker) approval. Clicking the Action button will display the Check Beneficiary File Upload form.

section.title: Beneficiary File Upload form - General Details
section.para: Click the Upload New File button to display the Add Customer Beneficiary File Upload form. This form has sections for General Details and File Upload Details. After entering the details, click Submit at the bottom of the form. The beneficiary details will be uploaded into the system.

note.para: This form is available for profiles with maker role if maker-checker is enabled for your company.

section.para: The form is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Add description and product category in this section.
Enter a description or name for the beneficiary file upload.
This field defines the Product Type of the beneficiary and determines the beneficiary details required. Select a product type from the dropdown list, as shown below. (Mandatory)

Cashier's Order/Demand Draft Third Party Transfer MT 101 Telegraphic Transfer Request MT 103 Telegraphic Transfer Domestic Transfer India Domestic TransferDifferent input fields will be required based on the selection made. For details on the input fields required, refer to specific product types information in further subsections. For example, refer to subsection 'Cashier's Order/Demand Draft - Beneficiary File Upload Details' for product type Cashier's Order/Demand Draft.

row.entry: Add a file from here. The information for the maximum number of files that can be uploaded is displayed here. The rows in this section display details for Title and File Name of uploaded files.

entry.para: Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

row.entry: Click this button to open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.

para.programlisting:
In portal.properties, update the following configurations to enable External Account Statements Upload
swift.system.name.mt940=SWIFT

The form is as follows:
Field
Type
Description
General Details
This section describes the general details of the External Accounts Statement File Form.
Description
The description added in the Title field is displayed here.
File Upload Details
Add a file from here. The information for the maximum number of files that can be uploaded is displayed here. The rows in this section display details for Title and File Name of uploaded files.
Add a File
Click this button to open the File Details popup. Enter the title for the file upload and browse to the location of the file, and select the file to upload.
Title
Enter a name for the file to be uploaded. This is displayed in the Description field.
File
Browse to the location of the file and select it.
The rows in the SWIFT MT940 format are represented by codes. The codes and the corresponding decriptions are given below.
20 - Transaction Reference Number (Mandatory) 21 - Related Reference (Optional) 25 - Account Identification (Mandatory) 28C - Statement Number/Sequence Number (Mandatory) 60a - Opening Balance (Mandatory) 61 - Statement Line (Optional) 86 - Information to Account Owner (Optional) 62a - Closing Balance (Booked Funds) (Mandatory) 64 - Closing Available Balance (Optional) 65 - Forward Available Balance (Optional) 86 - Information to Account Owner (Optional)
The code 25 for account identification requires a 11-digit ISO code with a separator A after the eighth digit. This is as specified for SWIFT MT940. For example, if the account number is AMIYAL80INR, then it has to be entered as AMIYAL80AINR in the upload file, with the separator A after the eighth digit.
Click this button to download the file to the local system. This button is displayed once you have added a file.
Click this button to delete the uploaded file. This button is displayed once you have added a file.

section.title: Data Maintenance - Facility Maintenance

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Payee Maintenance module to register and maintain Bill payment and Direct debit Authorisations.
These payments have been loaded into the Fusion Corporate Channels through other modules and facilities.

section.title: Payee Maintenance Options
section.para: The Payee Maintenance options are part of the System Features menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Register Bills loaded into the system
Update previous Bills registered into the system

section.title: Payee Maintenance - Register Bill Payment
section.para: Register Bills loaded into the system.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the existing bills in the system. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Bank, Payee Name, Category, Status and Actor fields at the top of the page.

note.para: The Status and Actor fields are available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: The list of existing customer counterparties has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description

row.entry: The Payee's Bank

entry.para: The name of the Payee
The category of the bill
The description of the Payee.
This indicates the status of the pending record set by the checker.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

entry.para: Displays the user ID of the maker of the transaction.

note.para: This column is only available if maker-checker functionality is enabled.

section.para: Click the Register Bill Payment button at the bottom of the list to register a bill payment payee. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of all the Bill Payees that has been configured for your user profile. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Bank, Payee Name, Category and Payee Description fields at the top of the page. Click on the required row to view the General Details form for the Bill Payee. The form is as follows:

section.title: Register Bill Payment form - General Details
section.para:
When a bill entry is selected the Register Payee - Bill Payment form is displayed. This form allows the Entity to be allocated to the bill for payment.
Field
Type
Description
Activate
This box is ticked to indicate the Bill will be registered. (Click the Cancel button at the bottom of the screen to cancel the registration)
Entity
Entity within your company that this Bill is to be allocated to. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Payee Name
The name of the Payee.
Description
The description of the bill. This field can be updated at this stage if required.
Bill Ref
The reference for the bill payee.
This can be a text field or a dropdown based on the settings selected by the Bank administrator.

section.title: Overview
section.para: Fusion Corporate Channels can send email's to specified users to alert them when your company receives notifications from the bank; for instance when the bank has accepted your company's Import Letter of Credit request, or has advised your company as an exporter about a new Export Letter of Credit. Alerts can also be sent at chosen milestones, for instance Expiry date or Last Shipment date.

As an administrator at a client company, you use the Alerts module to specify, for a given product and transaction type or milestone date, the users who are to receive alerts. You can specify that an alert be sent to the user who played a specific part in handling the transaction: input, control or release. In this case the email address and the language to use (English or French) are taken from the user's data in the system. Alternatively, you can enter an email address and select the language explicitly. You cannot enter wording for the email. Standard wording is used.
The set of actions for which alerts can be sent is configured by the bank in a system configuration file.

note.para: Additional custom types of alerts (for example, SMS messages) may also be available and configured in this module.

section.title: Alerts Maintenance - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Alerts Maintenance function, from the toolbar, select Administration > Alerts Maintenance.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the Alerts Maintenance function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Report Designer module to design reports, which can then be run by all users in your company. These reports cover the products available in Fusion Corporate Channels such as letters of credit, guarantees, and so on. The form for designing a report has a checkbox labelled Publish Report. As long as you do not tick this, the report is not made available to your users even if you save it. The report is said to be not executable.

listitem.para: When you have finished designing the report and want to release it so users can execute it, you should then tick this checkbox.
At present, this feature is supported only for Trade and Cash. It is not applicable for Loan and Treasury.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: In this chapter, we use the word "report" to mean a report design, rather than an actual generated report. Thus for example "updating a report" means updating the specification of the report, rather than generating a new report with the latest figures.

section.title: Report Designer - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Report Designer function, from the toolbar, select Administration > Report Designer.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the Report Designer function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Report Designer Options
section.para: After selecting Administration > Report Designer from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for Report Designer in the left side navigation menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: Create a report from a blank form.
Create a report from an existing report.
Create a report from a template supplied to your company by your bank.
Update an existing report.
Alter report parameters
Define report schedules

section.title: Report Designer - Create
section.para: This option allows an Administrator to create a report from a blank form.
When you select this option, you are presented with the blank form. The form is as follows. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

section.title: Create form - General Details
section.para: In this section, you give high level information about the report.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Name of the report. Your users will identify it by this name.
Description of the report.
Tick here so that when you save the report it will be made available for all users in your company to execute. Leave it unticked until you are satisfied with your design of the report.
Default value is not ticked.
Maximum number of lines per page. Defaults to 25.

section.title: Create form - Products
section.para: In this section, you list the product types to be covered by the report.
There are two types of reports:

listitem.para: A single-product report is a report on a single product (for example, LC).
A multi-product report is a report on several products (for example, LC + EL)

section.para: If you define a single-product report, you can include in it all the fields of the selected product. If you define a multi-product report, you can include only fields common to all products.

You specify the product(s) to include from a dropdown list on the Product field in the form. For a single-product report, or the first product of a multi-product report, the dropdown list includes all products available to your company.

Fusion Corporate Channels distinguishes between transactions (the individual messages that pass between client and bank), masters (the master file describing the product, in its latest state), and templates (the templates from which you can create some types of product). A report can only cover one of these three types.

For example, say a client initiates a Letter of Credit for 1000 GBP. That creates a transaction. When the bank approves it, a master is created. If the bank subsequently sends a message changing the amount to 500 GBP, a new transaction is created and the master is updated. The master always reflects the latest state of a file.

Whichever type you select for your first product - master, transaction, or template - the dropdown list for subsequent products you add offers you only that type. For example, if you select Letter of Credit Transaction as the first product, then for subsequent products you can select among Export Letter of Credit Transaction, Export Collection Transaction, etc.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
This checkbox indicates if the report is multi-product or single-product. Defaults to not checked.

The rest of this section is a list of products that the report is to cover. If none has been selected yet, there is simply the text No product selected instead. Click Add Product to open a sub-form to add one. You cannot add more than one if Multi-product Report is not ticked. The sub-form is as follows:
A product to include in the report. Select from the dropdown list. See the explanation above regarding the content of this list..
Click to add the product to the list of products.
Click to close the form and not add its contents to the list.

section.para:
You can change a product by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Once you have specified the product or products to be included, further sections are displayed where you can define the displayed columns, parameters, filters, overall aggregation and grouping.
If these details are already defined and the current product is changed, these details are removed. If no product is selected, these sections disappear.
Click the Add Column button to add new columns to the report.

section.para:
You can change a column's description by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it from the report by clicking the Delete
icon. You can reorder the columns by using the Move Up
icon to move a column up in the order of appearance in the report and similarly use the Move Down
icon to move a column down.

section.title: Create form - Parameters

note.para: This should not be confused with the Parameters function from the Report Designer menu.

section.para: In this section, you list the parameters that are to be used in the report.

A parameter is the way to ask the user to enter a value to be used in executing the report. For example, you can design a report of existing letters of credit, define a parameter Expiry Date and include a filter using this parameter - for instance, letters of credit with an expiry date earlier than this parameter. Upon executing the report, the user would be asked to enter an expiry date. The resulting list would display all letters of credit with an expiry date earlier than the one entered.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

Name of the parameter.
Label to be used when the user executing the report is English-speaking. Mandatory. This label will appear in front of the input field displayed for this parameter when the report is executed.
Click the plus sign to display fields where you can specify labels for the other languages available. These are optional. Click the minus sign to hide these fields again.

section.title: Create form - Filters
section.para: In this section, you list the filters that are to be used in the report.
A filter is a way of selecting a subset of products. A filter is made of one or more criteria. Each criterion describes a constraint.

When the report is executed, the items included in the report are the ones that meet the constraints described by at least one of the filters. An item meets the constraints of a filter, when it meets the constraints of each criterion within this filter.
This section is a list of filters that the report is to have. If none has been defined yet, there is simply the text No filter instead. Click Add Filter to open a sub-form to add one.

It is possible to compute aggregates on a column of the report, for example a sum over a column.
These overall aggregates are based on the whole report, unlike the aggregates you define in Grouping (see below), which can be based on parts of the report.
Possible aggregates are:

Displays the sum of values of the selected column.

Description

para.guilabel: Create a chart for this report

entry.para: Tick this box if you want to include a chart in your report. The fields described below appear when you tick this box.
Type of chart. Select from the dropdown list: Pie, Bar, Line, etc.
Column to be used as the X-axis or other baseline (depending on the type of chart). Select from the dropdown list.
Select the scale or the X Axis from the dropdown list. (depending on the type of chart)
Click to display a popup form where you can specify the column to be used as the Y axis. The form is describe below.
Column whose variation against the X-axis or other baseline (depending on the type of chart) is to be shown by the chart. Select from the dropdown list.
The aggregate operator. The list of available aggregate operators depends on the type of column selected as the Y axis, as follows:

listitem.para: Count aggregate operator is available for a string column,
Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a date column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for an amount column,
Sum, Count, Average, Maximum, Minimum aggregate operators are available for a number column.

entry.para: Label to be used for Axix Y, when the user executing the report is English-speaking. If left blank, the column name is used, followed by the aggregate type.
Click to add the column chosen for the Y-axis to the list of such columns.
Click to abandon adding the column and close the form.

section.para:
You can change a Y axis's description by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it from the chart by clicking the Delete
icon.

section.title: Report Designer - From Existing
section.para: Create a report from an existing report. The details of the existing report are copied to the new one, except the report name, description and executable status. This is set to non-executable.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name field at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name and Report Description of each report.

Click in the Report Name column to open a new report form, populated with the details from the selected existing report. The description of each field in the report can be found in the section on Report Designer - Create Form

section.title: Report Designer - From Template
section.para: Create a report from a template supplied to your company by your bank.

The template name is used as the report's name. If this name is already used by an existing report, the report name is suffixed with the string [i] where i is an incremental index that distinguishes the new report name.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of report templates that your company has. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name field at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name and the Report Description of each template.

The user selects the required templates through the dedicated check-boxes, and then press the Submit button. The description of each field in the report can be found in the section on Report Designer - Create Form

section.title: Report Designer - Maintenance
section.para: Update an existing report.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of existing reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name field at the top of the page.
The columns show the Report Name, Report Description and Executable flag of each report.

You can modify a report by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, delete it by clicking the Delete
icon, or preview it by clicking the Preview
icon. Previewing it executes it, using your own permissions and your own company's data.

section.title: Report Designer - Parameters
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Report PDF Parameters module to set up parameters such as logo, header and footer texts for PDF documents generated from custom reports.

note.para: This should not be confused with the Parameters section of the Create form - Parameters section described in this chapter.

section.para: When you click this function, you are presented with a blank form.

section.title: Parameters Form
section.para: The form is as follows. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Click the Browse button to enter the name of an image file to attach to reports.
The logo should be a .GIF or .JPG image. The recommended size is 50x150 pixels.
We recommend you generate a test report in PDF format to check the logo is rendered correctly, and adjust and reload the logo size.
Text to appear next to the logo at the top of the page, on the left hand side. Three lines of 35 characters.
Text to appear in the centre of the footer. Up to 65 characters.

section.title: Report Designer - Schedule
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Schedule Report module to schedule reports to be executed automatically at a given frequency, with the results sent to a specified recipient via email. There is no need for any user to actually be connected to Fusion Corporate Channels while a scheduled report is running. The report is executed as if it was being run by a user with access to the company's full jurisdiction (that is, with access to all available permissions given to the company and all its entities). You can select the format (CSV, Spreadsheet or PDF) of the results sent as an email attachment and the language in which the report is generated.
You cannot customise the actual time of day when a scheduled report is executed. This is configured in the technical properties of the MP application and defined by the Bank technical administrator.

When you click this function, you are presented with a list of all the existing scheduled reports. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Report Name and/or Frequency fields at the top of the page.

The list of scheduled reports has the following columns:
Field
Description
Report Name
Report Name
Frequency
Batch Frequency (Daily, Weekly or Monthly). Depending on the frequency, additional information is provided:
Weekly: the abbreviated name for the chosen day of the week.
Monthly: the day of the month (as a number).
Output Format
Chosen Output format :
CSV: Comma Separated Value.
Spreadsheet: format compatible with Microsoft Excel.
PDF: Adobe Acrobat format.
Next Batch
For information, the date of the next report execution is indicated.

You can modify an entry by clicking the Edit
icon in the right-hand column, or delete it by clicking the Delete
icon.
Click the Add a new report schedule button at the bottom of the list to add an report to the schedule.

section.title: Schedule Report Form
section.para: Edit and Add display the same form, but in the case of Add it is blank and in the case of Edit it is preset with the existing details of the schedule for the report. After entering the details, click Save at the bottom of the form.
The form is as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Selection of the report
Three choices are available:

listitem.para: Weekly: the user has to choose the day of the week.
Montly: the user has to select the day of the month

entry.para: The format of the attachment containing the results of the report and which is going to be included in the email sent upon the scheduled date is defined here:

listitem.para: CSV for a Comma Separated Value file,
Spreadsheet for a format compatible with Microsoft Excel,
PDF for the Adobe Acrobat format.

entry.para: Select box with all available languages. This choice will determine in which language the report will be executed and therefore the language of the results. It is also used to set the language of the actual email message.
The email address of the recipient (40 characters maximum).

section.title: Overview
section.para: As an administrator at a client company, you use the Audit Queries module to monitor actions carried out by users of Fusion Corporate Channels in your company. This is particularly useful to trace actions that failed authorisation, for technical issues, and for security monitoring of login attempts or jurisdiction manipulation.

section.title: Audit Queries - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Audit Queries function, from the toolbar, select Administration > Audit Queries.
Alternatively, depending on the Administration function already selected, there may be a link to the Audit Queries function in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Audit Queries Options
section.para: After selecting Administration > Audit Queries from the toolbar, a number of options are provided for Audit Queries in the left side navigation menu. They are as follows:

listitem.para: List all login (successful or unsuccessful) and logout actions.

List all actions regarding product transactions. For example, you can use this to audit submissions that failed because of jurisdiction problems, so you can consider modifying the amounts in authorisations.
List all uses of System Features, including the Change Profile, Jurisdiction Maintenance, User Maintenance and Data Maintenance modules.

section.title: Audit Queries - Login
section.para: This option allows an Administrator to list all login (successful or unsuccessful) and logout actions. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of login and logout actions that have taken place.
You can filter the list by entering in search criteria and clicking Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The search criteria fields are as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
These two dates set the time frame for the inquiry. You can type them or click the calendar icon and select them from the popup.
Login name of the user who performed the action.

Result of the action. Select from the dropdown list: Successful when the action succeeded, Permission denied when the action failed, or Technical error for unexpected technical errors that should be investigated.

section.para: The list of actions that is returned has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
The action.
Date and time of the action. The timestamp is related to the user timezone.
User who did the action.
Result of the action: Successful when the action succeeded, Permission denied when the action failed, or Technical error for unexpected technical errors that should be investigated.
Displays the IP address of the device with which the user logged in

section.para: Click in the Action column to see the full details of an action.

section.title: Audit Queries - Product
section.para: This option allows an Administrator to list all actions regarding product transactions. This includes all actions regarding product transactions, ranging from the simple opening of a Product module and access to a list of transactions, to the opening and submission of a new transaction, and also including all product maintenance actions. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of product transaction actions that have taken place.
You can filter the list by entering in search criteria and clicking Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The search criteria fields are as follows:

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Product that the inquiry is to cover. Select from the dropdown list, which all the products accessible by your company. (for example, Bankers Guarantee, Bill Payment, Export Letter of Credit, etc.).
These two dates set the time frame for the inquiry. You can type them or click the calendar icon and select them from the popup.
